name: Courtyard by Marriott Greenville Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at this hotel in August. Our purpose was to explore the downtown area of Greenville. We were able to check in early and were quite surprised and delighted with the hotel; as a matter of fact, we often felt we were in more of a luxury hotel than in a Courtyard. The lobby area is especially nice, with a nice bar area, a wonderful restaurant (Nantucket--which was doing a booming business!), and a relatively large computer area. In fact, when we didn't receive a morning newspaper and didn't receive our bill under the door, we had to remind ourselves that we were "only" in a Courtyard! We were in a king room on the 5th floor, and the view of Greenville at night was especially lovely. The hotel is, as others have pointed out, in the middle of the downtown area. To the left of the hotel is the pretty tree-lined area for shopping, cafes, bars, restaurants. To the right is the river area--really beautiful--with more restaurants, etc. Add to it all is the fact that the hotel is fairly new, so there are no worn areas in rooms, hallways, lobby, etc. The breakfast is Starbucks in the lobby--with breakfast sandwiches, some breakfast plates, and pastries. We stayed there on points; however, we felt that the $152 asking rate was a bit steep. It was the same, too, for a weekend night. Otherwise, we were impressed with our stay.
reviews.title: A lovely Courtyard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful, fairly new Courtyard Marriott.. Rooms are good size, tastefully decorated and have a small fridge. Comfortable computer area in the lobby. Parking is by valet or $8 self parking for 24 hrs. However, the best reason to stay here is the fabulous location, smack in the middle of downtown Greenville.
reviews.title: location, location, location

reviews.text: I had a great experience at this hotel. I stayed only one night for business, but the staff was very friendly, the room was clean and spacious, there was free WiFi in the room, so well suited to business travelers. It's very conveniently located in the heart of downtown Greenville, so it's easy to take a nice walk around town. Excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Downtown Greenville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This new property is about as nice as it gets for a Courtyard. All new Bistro generation, with a excellent seafood place in bottom, Nantucket. The location is perfect, on the main drag between the shopping/cafes and the riverwalk area. Staff, room and setting was top notch.
reviews.title: This is one nice new Courtyard, with Bistro and also a great seafood place

reviews.text: Enjoy Greenville, a nice classic fun small town with a good art and cuisine scene.
reviews.title: The business meeting could not have gone better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was trendy, the staff was extremely helpful. Rooms were nicely done the only criticism is that they have only one mirror in the whole room. Loved the lobby area that has a starbucks. The location is perfect located within walking distance to several venues. Will definately be spending more time.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: This is a new hotel that opened in the spring of 2010. As the other reviews state, it is right downtown within walking distance to all of the shops, the park, etc. The lobby area has loads of seating and there are seats outdoors in the grass covered courtyard as well. THe rooms and common areas, like the lobby, had a very contemporary design. The rooms were comfortable and the bathroom spacious. Our bathroom had a very large shower but no tub--this was not a problem as I prefer a shower but wondered if other rooms had bathtubs. The parking garage ($8.00/day) was very convenient--you used your room card as a parking pass so didn't need to bother with tickets, etc.
reviews.title: Great place in the heart of downtown.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located in the heart of the thriving dowtown, right next to the Peace Center for the Performing Arts. There are dozens of excellent restaurants within walking distance, and the Reedy River Park and amphitheatre are within two blocks. The decor is contemporary but inviting. There is a large courtyard in front of the hotel with a large man-made waterfall and outdoor seating for the attached restaurant. The staff was excellent. They upgraded me to a junior suite on the top floor, and I was warmly greeted each time I entered and exited the hotel. Parking in the garage is $8/day, but you can come and go as you please.
reviews.title: Great Location - Smart Design

reviews.text: My only complaint is the windows are not sufficiently soundproofed. There was quite a bit of noice coming in from Main Street, perhaps amplified by the courtyard below. This is not a very significant issue as the noise died considerably by midnight. In the future I will request a room facing Broad Street to avoid the noise of Main Street pedestrians.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, nice location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel this past weekend and it was very nice HOWEVER when we received the billing summary for the three nights we stayed we found a restaurant charge that was not only timed before we have even arrived in Greenville but as we pointed out when checking out to the desk - the restaurant had been closed for 2 hours before we checked in. There was also charges for two five dollar bottles of water that we had not taken.
reviews.title: Fraudulant Charges to Our Room Billing - Beware!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We discussed this with the desk who assured us it would be removed form the statement -they checked and the restaurant ticked lacked a signature also.
reviews.title: Ideal Location in Downtown Greenville

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visit Greenville often, and have found the Courtyard Greenville Downtown an ideal base. EVERYTHING was within walking distance, the rooms big and the service good. We arrived on the night of the GOP presidential debate and all the streets were blocked. The police let us through to the hotel, and a warm welcome awaited. Although 90 rooms were taken by press, we were made to feel like the most important guests they had received. The next morning, when all those reporters checked out, we found an amiable chambermaid who wished us a blessed day and made sure our room was cleaned. When a hotel does this well when it has many people checking out and in--and she told us 114 rooms were checking in for Furman graduation--we know they are well run. Whenever possible, this will be our choice in Greenville.
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay and tour the downtown.

reviews.text: Greenville SC is my new favorite downtown. And the Marriott Downtown made it a perfect trip. We parked the car on arrival and walked the entire weekend. The hotel is very modern in decor and style. ALL staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful during our stay. We were upgraded to a suite and it was fabulous. I highly recommend it. The courtyard was breathtaking with it's waterfall and lawn. We would have stayed out there forever if it wasnt so windy that day. Hotel is in the center of activity in downtown, yet the way the courtyard and hotel were landscaped, it was so quite and peaceful. It was very well designed, so you didn't hear the noise of the city. I've already planned a "girls weekend" and we are staying in the same place. I dont want to try any other hotels.
reviews.title: Perfect location, service with a smile

reviews.text: Recently stayed for a friend’s wedding. The hotel was very accommodating to my family and I. The room we had was a King suite with pull out sofa. I wouldn't recommend the sleeper sofa for 2 adults but perfect for the kiddies. The suite was roomy and large, enough space for my little girl to feel at home. Hotel is within walking distance to keep you and your family entertained for days!! Great location, good service, lots to do!!
reviews.title: well-equipped

reviews.text: I met colleagues and a customer at this Hotel. It was the classiest Courtyard that I have ever seen. The hotel is right in the center of town across the street from the Peace Center, a concert and entertainment venue. The room was classy and very comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: What a beautifiul Hotel

reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this hotel.
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel, good attached restaurant/bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel - clean and simple lobby with nice touches *interactive wall map, free coffee, etc), and nice rooms. The hotel seems new - and is at the end of Main Street... a block from Falls Park... a perfect location.
reviews.title: Great location, wonderful hotel.

reviews.text: Staff was friendly and attentive. Nice fitness room, open 24 hours. Free WiFi. Parking is attached (for $8 per day) or you can park on the street. The restaurant (Nantucket Seafood) is attached to the lobby and is a good place with a nice vibrant upscale bar. All in all - recommended for a convenient and hassle free stay in Greenville.
reviews.title: Great location! Ruined some of my clothes

reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel for business a couple of times. This past visit was for business and leisure as I was able to bring my wife along for this trip. We absolutely loved our 6th floor room overlooking the actual grass courtyard and downtown Greenville. The staff was friendly and accommodating. I am a MR member - Platinum level - and I know my Marriott hotels. This one ranks in my top five favorites. The only downside is the "pay for parking" and the lack of a dedicated restaurant for breakfast.
reviews.title: We will be back!

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Greenville Downtown Hotel Greenville
description: There’s a buzz on the streets of Greenville, SC. An excitement for the new hotel in the heart of downtown. The experience you’ll discover within our walls reflects the one you’ll relish just outside of them. Contemporary décor along with modern architecture will blend seamlessly with Marriott Courtyard’s signature hospitality and dedication to excellence. An experience that is both specifically Courtyard and uniquely downtown Greenville.
